title: (x) Tomita Isao album cover type - (similar to) Sinaloa {Brett Jordan, Stephen}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/tomita_newest_sound_4523.gif)

Hi,

I am looking for a typeface matching or similar in style to this record sleeve (the “Tomita” logo). I can’t really classify this, but think late 70s - early 80s sci-fi/pop, early electronic music...

It must not necessarily be a 100% match, just in the same “mood” as this one.

Cheers chaps!

 [‹ (x) "Into The Void" Art Deco geometric sans caps - Chi-Town {Angel}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32657 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Warner Bros Pictures Inc. - hand lettered {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32642 "Go to next forum topic")
author: huggyGiraffe

comments.content: [Sinaloa](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=20&currpage=1&totalrecords=2&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=sinaloa&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=TOMITA) is close. And you might like [Matra](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.106306.0.0), [Stop](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=UR.116336.0.0), or [Dazzle](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=DET0000260).
Thanks, good recommendations so far. Sinaloa is very very close. But I am looking for something even more extravagant than Dazzle or Matra. Stop is very good, though! Instant Vangelis ;-)
NEUE AGE! Can you elaborate on “extravagant”?
I can try...maybe I was thinking more “cheesy 70s cheap italian sci-fi / horror movie poster” - extravagant...does that help?

That’s a tall order. The only ’70s Italian flicks I know are Westerns. Here’s some scatter shot:

[Franosch](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.116754.0.0)  
 [Chromium](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=chromium)  
 [Linear](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=EF.100654.0.0)  
 [Braggadocio](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=M.267.0.1)  
 [Futura Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=futura%20black)  
 [Cirkulus](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=cirkulus)  
 [Data 70](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories=1&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=data+70)  
 [Amelia](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=amelia)  
 [Countdown](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Countdown)  
 [Orbit-B](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=orbit-b)

Stephen, thank you very much...

Some of these are cool, but the lower few ones are more likely “Stanley Kubrick cheese-free sci-fi”. It should be more “over-the-top glamorous spacetravel” sci-fi...

Not very sure but you can have a look in [Buro Destruct](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.typedifferent.com/2007/index.html) and in [Ainsifont](http://web.archive.org/web/20071214200238/http:/www.ainsifont.com/).
